question_text: A device has IP 10.0.8.10, subnet mask 255.255.252.0, and default gateway 10.0.12.1. Why can’t it reach the internet?
answer_options: The IP is not valid in the assigned subnet
The default gateway is outside the local subnet
The subnet mask is incorrectly formatted
The device must use a public IP address
correct_answer: The default gateway is outside the local subnet
explanation: A /22 mask (255.255.252.0) covers 10.0.8.0–10.0.11.255. The default gateway at 10.0.12.1 is outside this range.
